shuttle.desc: Though shuttlecraft are usually used to ferry goods between ships, or save larger ships from needing to entering atmosphere, some shuttlecraft are equipped with jump drives and used as extremely cheap merchant ships. The model manufactured now has been frozen since its development by the shipwrights of Accra.

civlightfi.desc: An older but still widely used fighter type, the Sparrow is fast and agile, but it's light weight and small frame leave little room for expansion. This version is a proper starfighter, but most versions still in use are designed for carrier bays.

civhvfi.desc: One of the few starfighters actually suitable for a trader pilot, the Heavy Fighter has decent cargo room and expansion space, and fuel scoops, originally designed to support its pair of lasers, but able to extend its range as a cargo trader as well.

fanwing.desc: The Petrel is FuHao's most famous, if not most popular product. It's sold as a luxury yacht on the consumer market, boasting superior in-atmosphere preformance over even the most nimble aerospace fighters due to its VTOL fans and large dorsal fin. On the professional market its sold on its ample cargo bay and integral fuel scoops.

sleek.desc: This is actually the smallest vessel offered by Accra Starworks, and a very popular one for up and coming traders.

reduxsys.desc: Designed to run dangerous cargo routes, the Argosy is a mix power and trade efficiency.

bulk.desc: Designed for safe cargo routes, or to fly under escort, the Bulk Freighter is a gigantic cousin of the shuttle. Often cited as a case of Accra selling out, it is the favorite of peaceful traders who enjoy well polieced routes, and of pirates who enjoy easy prey.

jumbo.fullName: Meklin Design Bureau Oxana class Freighter
jumbo.desc: One of the better cargo ships in the universe, it sports a battery of engines and a decent protection suite. It is Meklin's best selling offering, though rumors abound that it is sold at a loss to hide profits from the League. It has a huge cargo bay, but also enough room for some armament.

veraclass.fullName: Meklin Design Bureau Vera class Escort Frigate
veraclass.desc: You could say that the Vera is a compromise between raw power and elegance, but that would be selling the Melkin design bearu short. One of the best ships on the civilian market, traders and mercinaries alike salivate over the prospect of flying one of these monsters.

pertinax.desc: Built off of Melkin's famous Vera class, the Pertinax is specialized for piracy, packing dragnet turrets and ion cannons. Probably the most feared pirate ship in the galaxy.

big.desc: The largest Freighter currently on the market, the Catacea is a wonder of engieneering. Several exotic metals and alloys are required to prevent it from being ripped apart not only when accelerating, but under its own gravity.

corvette.desc: The Corvette's power-to-weight ratio is its greatest strength-it is built fight aggressively. It can avoid being swarmed by fighters while still packing enough punch to take on larger ships.

melkinfi.desc: Melkin does everything larger, even fighters. This fighter is just scraping the edge of being a corvette, suitable for trader captains and aspiring mercinaries and traders working in dangerous space.

casaVette.fullName: Accra Starworks Type 991 Ausf. B Main Battle Starship
casaVette.desc: Based on an experimental design from the closing years of the empire, this is the Casamance Directorate's most common fighting starship. It serves many roles, from patrol to attack, all reasonably well.

casamanceempfi.desc: Basically, this is a repainted Old Empire Type 950, barely improved with more modern weapons. It is a point of pride in the Casamance Directorate to still run these ships, and what they lack in power is made up for in numbers. And the build quality of Accra Starworks is certainly better than the dodgy backwater shipyards that crank out the more common variant.

casaGunship.fullName: Accra Starworks Type 1132 Ausf.A Patrol Craft
casaGunship.desc: An all new design by Accra Shipyards, the versitile and powerful Casamance PT ship is designed to complament the fleet of Corvettes by providing a long range firebase.

casaCarrier.fullName: Accra Starworks Type 1125 Ausf. B Battleship
casaCarrier.desc: Accra produces one true warship, and this is it. Modeled after the Type 930, the 1125 is larger, slower, and able to carry more fighters into battle.

empfi.desc: Nearly Identical to the ships that swamred across the sector a generation ago, this is the starfighter version of the Emperial Fighter. The "Starfighter" desegnation is to make it clear that this ship is capable of FTL travel-not always the rule for ships its size. In its day, its linear aerospike engines (now a common sight) where a revelation. Its large wings offer a gentle landing for novice pilots, but don't be fooled-this no trainer. It's built to be as much an aircraft as it is a spacecraft. Ubiquitous, they are now manufactured (or repaired and resold) on most worlds.

empfrig.desc: This tall craft has been in service from generations, and was once a cutting edge warship. It is now available in many variants to the public, though this is the Type 925 version, with its original armament of plasma cannons and complament of fighters. Though its shields are somewhat lacking compared with modern ships, its hull is thick and its cargo bay-once used to carry shuttles full of soldiers into battle against rebellious worlds-more than capable of cargo runs of today.

empcru.desc: Once the most feared ship class in the galaxy, the Emperial Battlecruiser is still a sight to behold. It can carry an entire wing of Emperial Fighters, as well as its broadside battery of plasma weaponry. It was even large enough to be equipped with a nucelear generator enabling it to operate on long missions without returnign to port.

empsup.desc: Still a common sight in many systems, this was the backbone of the Empire's war machine. A simple but reliable hauler design, with more armor than most frieghters its size. It was meant to plough through blockades and deliver needed supplies to besieged stations. Now, since its plans have been widely distributed it's price has gone down signifigantly.

xicCruiser.desc: This ship goes on long missions for XIC, carrying wings of mining ships that actually do the mining. It has through-and-through engines, essentially similar to those of an OE fighter but simpler and simpler with an eye towards power generation rather than speed. Its internal docking ring protects fighters from harsher bouts with microasteroids.

xicFighter.desc: These ships fly out to mine asteroids, and ostensably aren't meant for combat. However, those who try to make a play for mining rights to an asteroid that XIC has its eye on may lead to an unfortunate accident

itaskafi.desc: Extremely fast and nimble, this fighter relies on its ability to dictate where and when the fight will happen to come up on top. Its loadout is focused on close range combat.

itaskabomber.desc: This long range starfighter has a giant sloped front hull, giving it an edge in the armor department. It carries long range weapons to compliment light fighters.

itaskacruiser.desc: The backbone of the seventh fleet, the Itaskan Cruiser is a formidable battleship. In addition to the fighters that it carries, some of the best in the galaxy, it is armed with heavy weapons and enough armor to, in a pinch, wade into a fight. Its gleaming nanosteel hull is a familiar sight in Itaskan space, but they're rare outside of it, as they keep to themselves.

itaskanbattleship.desc: The enormous Battleship is the last resort of the seventh fleet. Its rarity only adds to its renown, with rumors about its power and size abound. What is known for sure is that it isn't seen launching fighters, but rather charges into battle with distressing speed, shredding enemey ships to pieces. Its name, "Franklin" refers to a hero in Itaskan mythology, a mighty mortal who through his trickery managed to steal electricity from the gods.

leagueighter.desc: A smaller and more nimble version of the Sparrow, manufactured specifically for the Leauge navy. Variants of this ship make up the entire Leauge fighter corps. It is the main contribution of the FuHao the League technical sharing agreement.

leaguecorvette.desc: This is the league upgrade of the Kalvari, a small but fast and powerful starship. It is flexable, used for both away missions and dangerous missions behind enemey lines.

leaguecruiser.desc: A long range battleship designed specially for the league by all three members, the cruiser is small for its role, but its combat

leaguecarrier.fullName: Meklin Design Bureau Oxana class cargo ship (League Carrier Variant)
leaguecarrier.desc: A masterpiece of economy, the Oxana class is normally manufactured as a high-end cargo ship. However its enormous internal volume lends itself more so then other haulers of similar size to conversion into a carrier. This variant's internal cargo hold has been replaced by a stack of flight decks, and it is stocked with fighters and corvettes. Its armor has been thickened as well.

leaguebattlecruiser.desc: Designed by several members of the league, this is the best of all league tech put into one ship. All of the drawbacks are from poor tech integration.

schengenfi.desc: One of the smallest and cheapest fighters in the galaxy, this has very little to recommend as a personal ship, but is to be feared when fought in swarms.

schenfrig.desc: Built, like the Schengen fighter, with a large fuel scoop, the Schengen Frigate is unusual among ships of its size. It is heavly armed with mass drivers that do take advantage of its considerable power generation capacity.

ffempfi.desc: The fifth fleet's T950 variant is nearly identical to the one still manufactured across the old empire, as it is based on a late prototype, armed with then-new antimatter weapons. It retains many benifits of the '50 including its speed, though It cannot match the raw power of a NE Type 1153, or the speed of a League sparrow.

ffempfrig.desc: As with most fifth fleet technology, their variant of the battleship is based on prototypes developed near the end of the empire, not yet ready for full production. It has been modified for longer-range missions, originally intended to strike at the heart of Willkanuta space but now used to execute raids on the League and NE.

ffempcru.desc: This is the obvious upgrade of the 930 Battlecruiser, carrying improved fighters and weapons. Enormous amounts of resources are expended on these ships, and they are jealously protected...

ffVette.desc: An innovative design that came too late to be immortalized by the devotion of hundreds of factories, the 991 corvette was arguably the first such ship, with the long operational range of a scout fighter and some of a battleship's punch. It is often seen providing support for wings of fighters.

nelightfi.desc: Designed to strike fast, hit hard, and then quickly return to the ship carrying it or starbase, the Lightning isn't meant for long range missions. Its design is radical and new, closer to Khanda's heavy fighter than to a conventional empire design.

neshuttle.desc: Though shuttlecraft are usually used to ferry goods between ships, or save larger ships from needing to entering atmosphere, some shuttlecraft are equipped with jump drives and used as extremely cheap merchant ships. The model manufactured now has been frozen since its development by the shipwrights of Castor.

neheavyfi.fullName: NE Heavy Starfighter Type 1153 Ausf C
neheavyfi.desc: The Thunder is the legendary staple fighter of the Northern Empire, known and respected across the sector. There is a direct and obvious line between the OE fighter and this ship, with similar intake ramscoops and essentially the same rocket engines, just scaled up. Many describe it as " the OE fighter, perfected."

neVette.desc: Designed to work in concert with the generally lighter and more agile (both tactically and strategiclly) fleets of the Northern Empire, the Nimbus is a multi-role ship, making dangerous supply runs, bringing additional heat in firefights, and running back-water patrols. It is perhaps most notable as the main platform for lightning fighters.

nebattleship.desc: This exparamental warship is designed along the lines of a fighter rather than a standard corvette. Its self sufficiency is key to its success; they can operate totally independandly of the rest of the fleet, and support wings of deep-striking heavy fighters. Operating costs are also very low.

necruiser.desc: The enormous NE battlecruiser was built to replace the aging fleet of type 930s, which where barely large enough to accomodate the new heavy fighters. Though heavy fighters and battleships can operate deep in enemey terratory for extended periods, the value of having a hope base and firebase has been long recognized. Unfortunately, the price tag on a NE battleship has scaled up with the size, and very few have been launched, which has drawn criticisim when it is compared to the widely deployed League carrier. The designers, however, maintain that this ship is in a tier of its own, and should not be compared to the vastly inferior League carrier. The Comissar of the emperial fleet herself commands one of these monsters.

wlknfrigate.fullName: Willakanuta Space Command F14 light frigate
wlknfrigate.desc: The Willakanuta argue that they do not risk personell in fighters-the smallest ship that they use for battle (and patrol) is the F14. It is one of the most commonly seen WSC ships, used for recon, patrol, and fleet support.

wlknVette.desc: The spear like, aggressively sloped C36 corvette leans more towards a heavy fighter role, though it can't be carried so it's desegnated a light corvette. Its limited range keeps it from striking deep alone, but this serves the slow, methodical strategy that the WSC is feared for.

wlknbat.desc: What the G16 lacks in speed it makes up for in raw durability and firepower. It's long range weapons maintain steady streams of fire, preventing smaller, short ranged enemies from retreating.

wlknbattlecru.desc: The B93 is known as 'the surgeon' for its reputation for entering a system, and quickly devastating enemey forces. Very few are deployed, generally to skirmish with Itaskan battleships

wlkncarrier.desc: Large and brutal, the C20's hull is composed of thousands of pounds of solid, molecularly interlocked crystal. The crystals are so large that damage to the hull is more likley to occour due to fracturing crystals at the joints than penitrating them. It's rumored that this design is what prompted the Empire to begin developing antimatter weapons, and that the North is still fighting the last war.
